title: error on trying to set local directory in Thunderbird
content:
I'm having trouble trying to set my local directory in Thunderbird back to what it was before I messed up.

I stuffed up changing the local directory in Account Settings to point somewhere else, so I tried to point it back to where it was before. I also put back the copy I had made of the original profile- now it says- 

"The Local Directory path "C:\Users\vk7krj\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\1vgo1xlc.default-esr" is not suitable for message storage. Please choose another directory."

Yet I'm sure this was where it was pointing before I messed things up- what am I doing wrong?

I have over 20 years of emails and addresses on the line now so I am really hoping someone can help me get myself out of the mess I appear to have created.

Ken.
creator: bats059

title: Thunderbird
content: Hello! In Thunderbird version 141+, saving attachments from incoming messages is slow. The situation is as follows. A POP3 server and Thunderbird clients are deployed on the local network. When the Thunderbird client receives a message and it appears in the client as new, the user attempts to save all attachments (15 MB) and clicks "Save All." This process takes about 1.5 minutes. In Thunderbird version 115, saving attachments takes 5-10 seconds. Could you please tell me if there's a setting I need to disable in the Thunderbird client? Can I open the "Advanced Settings" in the client and see what specifically I can disable to speed up saving attachments? I've attached the mail server connection settings to my request.
creator: spelmond

title: Slow downloading of attachments
content:
Good afternoon!

Thanks for the great customer!

We have several computers on a local network without internet access. There is a problem in Thunderbird 143 - files are downloading slowly. POP3 and IMAP are the same. From several tens of seconds to one and a half minutes, 11 files from the letter were downloaded, totaling 20 MB. There is such a feature - if you disconnect the network adapter, the problem practically disappears. There was no such problem in the Thunderbird 115 version. The Em client and Mailbird clients were also installed for the experiment - they also do not have such a problem.

The mailbox is small and contains 20-30 almost empty emails.

Tell me, please, what can be done about it?

Sincerely, Yaroslav.
creator: admin5151

title: Get mail stopped working for old pop accounts when added Gmail account.
content:
Hi, Thanks for looking at this issue. I am traveling and my regular email provider's SMTP server cannot do outgoing relay for my own domain name. I do have a Gmail account also, so I thought about relaying through smtp.gmail.com. I got an app password and added the gmail account to Thunderbird. Downloaded gmail messages fine, and outgoing mail was fine. Incoming mail from my own account stopped coming in. When asking to get mail a blue bar is on the bottom right. After a while it goes away. My incoming mail server does not get a request. There is mail waiting to be delivered. Tried the following: Thunderbird safe mode: no change. Updated thunderbird to 115.18.0 : no change Restarted, etc: no change Opened error console: NS_ERROR_ABORT: Password dialog canceled 2 MsgIncomingServer.jsm:924 mailnews.pop3.2: NetworkTimeoutError: a Network error occurred Pop3Client.jsm:369:18 mailnews.pop3.2: SecurityError info: Pop3Client.jsm:408:20 This page is in Quirks Mode. Page layout may be impacted. For Standards Mode use “”. MsgIncomingServer.jsm This page is in Quirks Mode. Page layout may be impacted. For Standards Mode use “”. Pop3Client.jsm NS_ERROR_FAILURE: Prevent view-source recursion URIFixup.sys.mjs:1148

Tried removing the saved passwords for my account and for gmail. Get mail for gmail asks for a password. My account does not.

Any suggestions are welcome. Thanks much, Charles
creator: charles111

title: Missinf files in my local folders
content:
Good day, I have received your reply to my problem of missing files in my local folders after upgrading to T-Bird 143.0.1 Your reply is a “No reply” message so I have to start all over again with this new message to go forward. Here is what your reply said: re: I noticed that a large part of one of my local folders is missing.

I presume by local folders you are talking about the 'Local Folders' special account. So, if different you need to clarify.

YOUR REPLY: Please post/upload an image of the 'Folder Pane' which shows everything in 'Local Folders' account. Then post/upload images that show what is in the profile folder: Assuming you are using Windows OS 

   In search type: %Appdata%    select the %Appdata% file folder    Select 'Roaming' folder    Select 'Thunderbird' folder    Select 'Profiles' folder    Select name of profile folder    Select 'Mail' folder    Select 'Local Folders' folder

Make sure the view is showing all contents in column details format, extensions and hidden files must be allowed. Make window large enough to show all contents - or if necessary, post more than one image. This means I can compare profile with Folder Pane and check to see if appropriate files are missing. What Anti-Virus do you use? Is it allowed to scan your Thunderbird profile folders? Do you use any Anti-Virus or other cleanup program like CCleaner or Wisecleaner that cleans up temp files etc? If yes, then what do you use?

MY REPLY First, your instructions do not work because following your path, I go down each line until I reach (Select Profiles folder) Once opened it gives me the names of my 2 alpha numerical profiles and I opened each profile there is no such thing as "Local Profile" folder. The View shows all files, My AV is Bitdefender; I have no clean up software My system is w10 pro x64 I have been using T-Bird for years and installed dozens of updates always using my same system and tools so something seems to be wrong with the update itself. I will wait for your reply Thank you for your support Best Regards Douglas Noades
creator: douglasnoades

title: Sending emails from optus.net.com
content:
Since February this year, I cannot send any emails from my Thunderbird account which has an optus.net.com account. I receive the emails but when I try to send an email, a box appears with the message 'failed. Recipient address rejected due to domain discourages use of this host.'

I can send emails with optus address on my phone and other devices, but not using Thunderbird on my PC. I have contacted Aussie broadband which are my server provider who believe the issue is with Thunderbird. I have also contacted Optus who agreed that the issue is with Thunderbird.

I can send emails from Thunderbird which use aussiebb.com.au. I was able to send emails from optus.net.com prior to Feb 2025. I would appreciate talking to someone to help me solve this issue. Thanks, Louise.
